availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Casky (Christian County, Kentucky, overseer and farmer.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, overseer and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Ann Wood Casky in Christian County, Kentucky, on January 22, 1850. Father of Mary L. Casky and Ann Eliza Casky. Overseer in Christian County in 1850. Owned thirty-two enslaved persons in Christian County 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Co-owned ten enslaved persons in Christian County 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 361A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film 001942963.
Cemeteries of Christian County, Kentucky: 1797-2004 (Hopkinsville, KY: Christian County Genealogical Society, Inc., 2004), 83.
